ARTICLE.TITLE: Mayawati's BSP issues whip to six Rajasthan MLAs to vote against Congress in Assembly
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Ashok Gehlot maintained that his government has the required numbers to prove a majority in the House | Photo Credit: PTI

Key Highlights BJP to move no-confidence motion against Ashok Gehlot government The Supreme Court, on Thursday, refused to stay the decision by Rajasthan Assembly Speaker allowing merger of BSP MLAs with Congress

Jaipur: The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP), on Thursday, issued a whip to six Congress MLAs asking them to vote against the Congress party in a no-confidence motion against the government in the state Assembly. This is the second such whip to the MLAs and came just a day ahead of the session of the Assembly on August 14.

"All six MLAs have been directed under para 2(1)(a) of the Xth Schedule to vote against the Congress Party in any No-Confidence motion or any other proceedings to be held during the Assembly session of Rajasthan Assembly and if they violate the same they will face disqualification under para 2(1)(b) of the Xth Schedule," a press note by BSP stated.

On Thursday, the Supreme Court declined to stay a September 2019 decision by Rajasthan Assembly Speaker CP Joshi allowing the merger of six BSP MLAs with the Congress party. The decision came as a boost for the Gehlot government, which, now with the return of Sachin Pilot camp, may not require the support of BSP MLAs to prove a majority in the House.

BJP to bring a no-confidence motion

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies will be bringing in a no-confidence motion on Friday. The political turmoil in Rajasthan, which began after the political differences between former deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot and Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot surfaced, ended early this week after Congress party chief Sonia Gandhi assured Pilot to constitute a three-member committee to address the grievances raised by him.

Pilot was removed as deputy CM and expelled from party posts last month after he and 18 MLAs skipped Congress Legislative Party (CLP) meetings last month. While Gehlot blamed the BJP alleging horsetrading, he vehemently stated that his government had the required numbers to prove a majority in the House.

og.title: Mayawati's BSP issues whip to six Rajasthan MLAs to vote against Congress in Assembly
og.description: The Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) on Thursday issued a whip for the second time to six of its MLAs in Rajasthan to vote against the Congress in any no-confidence motion or any other proceedings in state Assembly.
